definition: before the present/(a long period) ago
at a distance of/distance/to be apart

sentences.english: Xuzhou, mausoleum of the king of Chu Country (about 2148 years ago), where Lanling Meijiu liquor was unearthed;
sentences.chinese: 徐州楚王陵出土的兰陵美酒距今已有2148年。

sentences.english: Luobi Cave was an origin habitation area that Hainan's people lived in that was over 10 thousand years ago.
sentences.chinese: 落笔洞是距今一万多年前最初的海南人居住的地方。

sentences.english: The Caveman site discovered in the Beijing Zhoukoudian area dates back about 30,000 years.
sentences.chinese: 而北京周口店的山顶洞人遗址，距今约三万年。

sentences.english: The city wall was built in the Tang Dynasty more than 1,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这古城始建于唐朝，距今已经有一千多年的历史了。

sentences.english: It’s been nearly 20 years since astronomers first identified a planet outside our solar system.
sentences.chinese: 人类首次发现太阳系外行星距今已有二十余载。

sentences.english: It's been just over two years since I got my first credit card.
sentences.chinese: 从我拿到我的第一张信用卡距今已经有两年时间了。

sentences.english: Here the rock by the relevant experts as three thousand years ago remains of Serbs.
sentences.chinese: 这处岩画经有关专家论证定为距今三千年的塞人遗存。

sentences.english: The age of Upper cave man site is estimated to exist in high-temperature period proximately 30,000 years till now.
sentences.chinese: 测定山顶洞遗址的年代，在距今3万年左右的高温期。

sentences.english: Dumplings have a 1, 800 year long history.
sentences.chinese: 饺子距今已有1800年的历史。

sentences.english: Tao is also close to five thousand years ago.
sentences.chinese: 陶文距今也接近五千年。

sentences.english: The Jiayu Pass has been standing here for 631 years.
sentences.chinese: 嘉峪关距今已有631年的历史。

sentences.english: It has a history of over 1,600 years.
sentences.chinese: 距今有一千六百多年的历史了。

sentences.english: Through the textual research, it began in the West Zhou Dynasty for more than 2,000 years.
sentences.chinese: 据考证，距今已有二千多年的历史，它始于西周时代。

sentences.english: That was a long time ago, in 1990.
sentences.chinese: 那是在1990年，距今已经很多年。

sentences.english: Has a history of over 1300 years.
sentences.chinese: 距今已经有一千三百多年的历史了。

sentences.english: They're two and half million years old.
sentences.chinese: 距今已有两百五十万年历史。

definition: Yangshao neolithic culture from the central Yellow river basin, with red and black pottery
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)
